DataElementConcept.preferredName: Transanal Excision Specimen Characteristic Specimen Integrity
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Surgery for rectal cancer that spares the anus and leaves the sphincter intact. Surgery is performed through the anus and removes only the rectal tumor and small amounts of surrounding tissue.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid ta:The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance._A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid ta:The state of being complete or undivided, of being sound or undamaged.

Concepts.definition: Surgery for rectal cancer that spares the anus and leaves the sphincter intact. Surgery is performed through the anus and removes only the rectal tumor and small amounts of surrounding tissue.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.
